Module project.inventorymanagement
Package project.inventorymanagement.Controller

Class ModifyPartController

java.lang.Object
project.inventorymanagement.Controller.ModifyPartController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyPartController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class creates a controller for the Modify Part form.

      public ModifyPartController()

  • Method Details

    • passPart

      public static void passPart(Part part)
      This method is a static method used to pass a part object from the Inventory Management System form controller. The method sets the static targetPart variable to the part parameter.
      Parameters:
      part - The part to be passed from the Inventory Management System form controller.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This is the method that executes when the Modify Part form is initialized. It populates the text fields with data from the part selected from the Inventory Management System form, and sets the Modify Part form to In-House or Outsourced based on the part type.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • modifyPartInHouseIfSelected

      public void modifyPartInHouseIfSelected(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the action event method for the In-House button. The method sets the text of Machine ID/Company Name label to Machine ID, and sets the formType to 0 to indicate the part to be added is an In-House part.

    • modifyPartOutsourcedIfSelected

      public void modifyPartOutsourcedIfSelected(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the action event method for the Outsourced button. The method sets the text of Machine ID/Company Name label to Company Name, and sets the formType to 1 to indicate the part to be added is an Outsourced part.

    • onModifyPartCancel

      public void onModifyPartCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the action event method for the Cancel button. The method redirects to the Inventory Management System form.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onModifyPartSave

      public void onModifyPartSave(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the action event method for the Save button. The method first checks for any input errors (including min <= inv <= max and min < max), displaying an error message if any is found. If there are no errors, the method updates the part with the new data, while retaining the same part ID. If the part type is changed, then the method creates a new part with the corresponding data (retaining the part ID), adds the new part to inventory and deletes the old one. The method then redirects to the Inventory Management System form.
      Throws:
      IOException
